alert.note: Alert for Clay; Oktibbeha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 5:57PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Oktibbeha and central Clay Counties through 630 PM CST... At 557 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Griffith, or 8 miles north of Starkville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Muldrow around 600 PM CST. Pala Alto around 605 PM CST. West Point around 610 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for northeastern Mississippi.
